meanings.definition: A straight direct route traveled quickly
meanings.sent1: The bee flew in a beeline to the flower.
meanings.sent2: She took a beeline to the store to buy milk.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a beeline for the acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The student made a beeline for the library to study.
meanings.sent5: The car zoomed in a beeline towards the finish line.

meanings.definition: To make a beeline for something
meanings.sent1: The cat will beeline towards the mouse.
meanings.sent2: He always beelines for the dessert table at parties.
meanings.sent3: The dog beelined for the treat jar when the owner wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: She beelined for the front row at the concert to get a better view.
meanings.sent5: The kids beelined for the playground as soon as school ended.
